Trigger A creature attempts to cross the lake by swimming or piloting a boat

Effect Ghostly arms reach up to grab and clutch at the creature or the boat, causing a â€“2 penalty to the Athletics or Piloting check that triggered the haunt. The haunt then rolls initiative.

stealth.details: (trained) to notice a weird, faintly glowing ripple of the current beneath the water.

details.description: A swath of drowned spirits tries to pull someone down into the water to join them.
details.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:23] to calm the unquiet spirits in the waters for an hour, or light the Eternal Lantern (automatically disables the haunt)

publication.title: Pathfinder #196: The Summer That Never Was

details.reset: The grasping currents quickly build up power and can trigger again after 10 minutes have passed.
details.routine: (1 action) On its initiative, the grasping currents attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Grapple] a swimming creature or capsize a rowboat by attempting an Athletics check with a [[/r 1d20+12 #Athletics]]{+12} modifier. A creature that's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Restrained] by the grasping currents is pulled underwater and risks drowning. To capsize a rowboat, the haunt's Athletics check is rolled against the pilot's Athletics or Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.
